intro: Amphineurion, commonly known as the sea holly, is a marine plant belonging to the family Zosteraceae. It is a flowering plant that thrives in shallow coastal waters, often forming dense underwater meadows. The plant has slender, branching stems covered in small, scale-like leaves. Its flowers are tiny and inconspicuous, typically arranged in clusters. Amphineurion plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various marine organisms.
